title: Can someone please give me some tips?
body:
So my MMR took a dive and I would like to avoid going into bronze at all cost. I ended season 4 Silver 1 and I started season 5 Silver 2, I have managed to drop my ass all the way to silver 5 with 0 LP. I find it amazing and yet awesome that high skilled streamers can climb from bronze to diamond in a matter of hours/days. Now this is very unrealistic for the average gamer but can someone please inform me how I can escape this crap. I mean, do I really have to be at a diamond level just to climb low elo? I know i'm not that good but this isnt the first time ive had games look like this graph. Tips please.

I had 100% Kill participation up to about 18 kills. Then as the game closed out in a Loss i finished 20/25 Kill participation. ( 12//8/8 )

replies.body: Learn to play a champion that can reliably carry. I suggest you learn to play Yi jungle. I got from Bronze 5 to Gold 1 playing only Master Yi. If you want to climb you'll need to main a champion that can solo carry games.
perhaps this is kind of a loaded/dumb question. But could you name a few who you fit this idea? First ppl that come to mind are like AD split pushers but I want to hear your thoughts.

Look at any thread complaining about a champion being OP. Learn them, and play them well. They are "OP" because they can reliably carry games and people just dont know how to not lose vs them.
Here are a few:
{{champion:238}}{{champion:55}}{{champion:84}}{{champion:11}}{{champion:69}}{{champion:75}} And last, but not least, {{champion:17}} (For da lulz)

There a hell of a lot of factors here. Teammates, type of champions on each side, rotations, roaming, minion management, ect. 

The only advice I can give you by going by your pic, is to roam. When you start to dominate mid, roam to the bot or top and give yourself a kill or 2. In bronze and silver, you have to carry yourself and not rely on your teammates. So pick champions that can snowball and go crazy. Roaming is one of the most beneficial things you can do when ahead. Also, be the shotcaller. If some idiot tries to ping Baron while the enemy team is still up, do not be afraid to say no. Positioning is also highly important that can either make you win or lose the fight. 

And try to watch some pro streams/esports that plays mid and see what they do and how they do it. Youd be surprised on how much you can learn from watching.

Other than that, no matter how good you may be doing, you will sometimes lose because of your teammates. Best of luck to your games m8.
yeah I roamed bot 2-3 times and each time was good trades for us. Which meant a lot because ther bot lane was up on ours... I guess it wasnt enough =\
Rather than helping a lane that will lose no matter how much you help them, its better to help snowball wining lanes. You would rather have 2 snowball lanes than only 1.

This is a very good point, I guess I felt killing a Shen @top was highly unlikely and not worth my roam.. at least with bot lane roams we could set up a drag if all went well. But Nonetheless i 100% agree with this and thank you for your input.

>at least with bot lane roams we could set up a drag if all went well.

Thats expecting your allies to know what that even means. 

Also, in case if you didnt know this already, but when jungling or roaming, ALWAYS ping to let your lane know that youre coming to gank and gives them time to set it up.

In Bronze and Silver, have the mindset of carrying yourself rather than carrying the team. Do things that would benefit only you and wield YOU the best results.
